snippet.title: 10 cool sculptures you can see at Sydney's Barangaroo
snippet.content:
If you're looking for a spot of culture this weekend, head to Barangaroo to immerse yourself in art by the water.
Nine established and emerging artists have installed 14 sculptures in partnership with the Sculpture by the Sea, best known for the annual sculpture show on the Bondi to Bronte coastal walk.
Five works were created specifically for the show and the artists include Michael Le Grand, Richard Tipping, Nicole Monks, Cave Urban, Andrew Rogers, Adam King from the Boomalli Aboriginal Artists Co-operative, Tereasa Trevor, Christopher Langton and Elyssa Sykes-Smith.
Here are 10 of the sculptures you can see down at the foreshore until August 20.
